title: Why can mids abuse the support role but supports are nerfed from playing mid?
body:
I don't understand this. Champs like annie, brand and velkoz can just line up in a support role and oppress the enemy lane but janna, nami and these other support mages scale so poorly with ap you could never succeed consistently with them in a solo lane (except maybe sona). If supports weren't just 100 percent utility and no damage after the first 2 minutes of the game people would be interested in playing them more often. 

And you know what, if they get too strong as a result, so be it. Maybe that's what the role needs to get people interested in it again.

Edit: Let's all be honest here, nobody is demanding that supports be able to 1 on 3 the enemy but the amount of damage they do past level 6 is beyond small. I am not advocating they be able to do anything more than REASONABLE damage under heavy AP-AD builds. Their current offensive damage with these builds is unreasonably low in my opinion and should be addressed.

replies.body:
Presumably, because support champs have such strong strong duo lane synergy that any hint of solo lane viability means their support function is inherently OP. 

Another problem may be that their supportive kit makes them very low risk. Lulu for example (a former support who moved midlane) will always have her utility, regardless of how fed she gets. Pair high ratio's with that, and you have a champ that is low risk, high reward. (that's my theory anyway)

meanwhile {{champion:238}}

Don't get me wrong I understand what you are getting at but We have a good bit of low risk champions who aren't getting that sort of treatment.

Yup. This is a relevant and constructive comment.

/sarcasm

Alright, I'd like to address the fact that {{champion:238}} is one of the safest champions in the game? Along with {{champion:223}} who does valid damage with NO damage items?

I'm arguing that just being low risk Isn't a fair enough reason to have support character only viable in support roles.
And I'm more than willing to hear your reason on why I am wrong. Maybe I am missing something?

Okay. The reason I made the super sarcastic comment is because this is a thread about supports being underplayed and not doing much damage and generally aren't viable elsewhere (gross over-simplification and stuff, but it's basically focusing on supports). Zed's a mid, not a support or a mid who is played supp sometimes. That's why I found it irrelevant to the discussion at hand.

Anyways, Zed may be safe, but he's easily countered. I'm not gonna say that Zhonya's totally negates his damage or whatever, but the fact is, before the Duskblade, he was definitely manageable and has tons of counterplay, not just itemization. Avoid his shadows, especially early game. Dodge shurikens, but if you can't do that, stay behind your minions. Don't overextend. Don't play aggressively. Avoid getting close enough that he can throw a shadow on the side of you opposite to him so he can get an easy EQ then switch with his shadow to AA+E and ignite for the kill.

Don't stay in lane with low health, especially if he has ultimate. Play incredibly safely once he has ultimate if you haven't killed him yet (which is difficult to do as he's incredibly strong and pretty safe early on). Most Zeds are impatient and will towerdive you, and if you have high health, you will kill him or at least get him to waste ultimate. If you don't let Zed get kills, he falls off pretty hard. Ping if he's MIA so he doesn't get fed off of the rest of your team. An unfed Zed is pretty much a liability to the team he's on.

Then Tahm Kench, I don't play him so Idk. He's just pretty ridiculous rn. Zed is too with the new item for sure.

And your last sentences, well, your post I first replied to didn't really make it out that you were saying that too well. The fact is, most supports have a lot of utility and CC, so it would be pretty fucking terrifying if a lot of those supports were played elsewhere. Zed has a slow and damage and mobility, no hard CC. If supports had more damage and were made stronger in other positions, it would require significant nerfs to their CC because lots of utility and hard CC mixed with damage is absolutely unfair, which is why Sejuani during the Cinderhulk meta was so OP whoever thought she should remain in that state for as long as she was deserves to be locked in an asylum.

Basically, utility + cc + damage would be really quite unfair and it's very difficult to make a champion that is primarily designed for utility purposes into a viable pick in other lanes without significantly increasing their damage or sustain output so they can do things on their own more easily. That would be unfair because then supports would have those increased stats which would not only make them good in other lanes, which on its own would be okay, but would make them fucking monstrous played as supports because they'd still have their utility and CC, but with added damage and such.

At least that's the way I see it. Sorry for the wall of text!
Why is it mages can bot then?  Vel, Annie, and brand bring cc and dmg to bot. I'm not saying supports need tons of damage, but some would be nice to facilitate going elsewhere.

Why? Because each of them has much less utility than a support. Vel'koz has a slow on his ultimate and Q and a knockup. I won't deny that's pretty good, but all of your examples are more for damage and stuff. Annie has a stun. That's it. No other utility. Just shit tons of damage and an AoE nuke with a stun (is the Annie has half a brain) and Brand has damage and a pretty long stun.

They're supports when you want to do tons of damage, not tons of utility. Kill pressure is gained by sacrificing utility in these places. And if you took, say, Thresh, and made him do much more damage, then he would be insanely overloaded and overpowered. You simply cannot have a champion with as much utility as a support and give them a great deal of damage because not only would they be pretty strong in other lanes/roles, but when played as a support, they'd be absofuckinglutely insanely overpowered.

The only way to give more damage to supports would be to mess with numbers a bit so they have higher ratios but lower bases, I think I'd be okay with that, but that would make builds that don't involve damage being built trash tier. But, it's either that or nerf their utility, which would kill the whole purpose of the support class.

I'm barely capable of thinking on a higher level right now, so I apologize if this was worded poorly or something in advance.

You are completely right. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 

It's just that I'm a support main and it would help me to be able to play those champs elsewhere. I also think it'd be more fun, but only if it didn't break them in either position. Not saying that's easy or possible, just that I'd like it.

Ah, thankies comrade. I am not usually very good at wording things, so I was worried it might not make sense xD

But yeah, that's the issue. Supports just have so much more utility, so balancing them to give them more damage would be an enormous pain in the ass, ya know?
Thank you for the wall of text. I like to read them.
Personally I prefer smashing my head into them just wishing for the end.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DVzqE0hAlGQ

Karma I personally never seen her as a support, EVER. She has and always will be a mid laner that has some nice utility.

Mid Karma will always do better in every way than support Karma since not only does she do the same thing, but also hit like a truck to boot.

Zilean I have seen him mid lane and become a force to reckon with if he isn't destroyed early game. unavoidable bomb nukes that with decent AP hit over 1k each is pretty hard to ignore. Hell I managed to get to 800 AP on him and literally 2 shotted an extremely fed Zed the rest of the game and made him entirely worthless since he literally had 2 seconds of life.
Lemonnation played Karma support in LCS, and I know in the past I've played her in that role, and fought against it before, but she's such an uncommon pick I'm not surprised you've never seen her.

It always has been an issue in the lower tiers,they always give champions with a weak and vulnerable early more room than they should.

Good, smart ones are extremely rare. Stupid ones are everywhere. Go check out spec live matches and find an actual Lulu support; most of them play like they are scripted midlaners. Playing like that as Lulu botlane will only screw up botlane even more, feed, and all wonder why she sucks.

FQC nerfs are deserved. You really think a targeted, long ranged, vision revealing, 4 second slow active ON A 60 SECOND COOLDOWN, plus ~2k gold worth of stats is actually fair? Especially with how expensive Morello's and Athene's used to be, no wonder why midlaners are rushing FQC... The active is so spammingly powerful that even tanks are getting it. The nerfs are deserved, and I'm still using it fine. Instead of mashing it whenever it is off CD because its cooldown used to be so short, a scouting item like this is supposed to be used whenever scouting is needed.

Lulu is definitely subpar **as a support compared to "meta" supports IN LANE**, but that doesn't mean she is absolutely shit just because certain players have no fucking clue on what Lulu's E even does upon ally cast. For instance, is Azir shit just because 90% of the playerbase don't know how to use him? No. In fact, her job in lane isn't even to outpoke people, but to babysit the crap out of her ADC as some kind of survival island, unless her ADC knows how she works and therefore can take an advantage of kill lanes, poke lanes... you name it. 

I never have a problem playing as Lulu support anytime during preseason, it's almost always my ADC who hardly ever know what on earth is a buff/debuff support. Some supports are simply "better" because their utility is more flashy and obvious, while as Lulu support her buffs are rather subtle. Yes, her shield is also an AA steroid; many people don't even know that. Vision? What about anticipation? How about instead of planting wards willy-nilly and get caught anyways, instead of just staying away unless there's an obvious minion shield when someone literally just walked in? Yeah yeah, sightstone does needs a bit of loving buffs here and there, but that alone doesn't mean a champion is absolutely shit.

TLDR she needs more than usual cooperation/game knowledge to be played botlane in general. If done right, it is actually pretty good. Not to the point where any random can tell what's going on, but that doesn't mean she's shit.

If you are not doing well on something, then you are probably missing out on something. I can help answer some questions if you would like.

Thing is supports are designed to function on a low budget, so if they ALSO scale well theyre pretty godly. Thats why theyre gimped in various ways to not work in solo lane. And often when they manage anyway its pretty ridiculous (raka and alistar a couple years ago)

This exactly.  Supports are early lane champs, they need strong base stats and rely on utility to stay relevant through the remainder of the match.

The moment any support champion has to start consistently relying on expensive items just to not be a complete hindrance to the team, perhaps as a direct cause of that character lacking the necessary bases and utility to be useful otherwise, that character has failed at the support role and become completely unplayable.

This becomes exponentially more problematic if the items that support is using as a crutch grant artificial numbers like with Spellblade.  At that point, the champion not only lacks the bases and utility necessary to support, they also lack the scaling required for normal itemization.  You're just left with an unplayable character that desperately clings to a fake sense of viability to mask the inherent underlying problems and that sadly people trick themselves into denying the truth of the situation.
